data.title: Basic HTML Tutorial
data.description: Learn the fundamentals of HTML with this comprehensive beginner's guide. Covers document structure, common tags, links, images, and lists to get you started with web development.
data.content: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":1},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Basic HTML Tutorials"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Welcome! This tutorial will introduce you to the basics of HTML (HyperText Markup Language), the standard markup language for creating web pages."}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Table of Contents"}]},{"type":"orderedList","attrs":{"start":1,"type":null},"content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://github.com/copilot/c/c5f9b6c1-3bab-44bb-a40b-542ceb2d5e03#what-is-html","target":"_blank","rel":"noopener HTML?"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://github.com/copilot/c/c5f9b6c1-3bab-44bb-a40b-542ceb2d5e03#html-document-structure","target":"_blank","rel":"noopener Structure"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://github.com/copilot/c/c5f9b6c1-3bab-44bb-a40b-542ceb2d5e03#common-html-tags","target":"_blank","rel":"noopener noreferrer nofollow","class":"text-muted-foreground underline underline-offset-[3px] hover:text-primary transition-colors cursor-pointer"}},{"type":"underline"}],"text":"Conclusion"}]}]}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"What is HTML?"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"HTML stands for "},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"HyperText Markup Language"},{"type":"text","text":". It is used to create the structure of web pages using elements called "tags.""}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"HTML Document Structure"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Every HTML document has a basic structure:"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"typescript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":" My First HTML Page "}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Explanation:"}]},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":""},{"type":"text","text":": Tells the browser this is an HTML5 document."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":""},{"type":"text","text":": Root element."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":""},{"type":"text","text":": Contains meta information (not shown on the page)."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":""},{"type":"text","text":": Sets the page title in the browser tab."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<body>"},{"type":"text","text":": Contains visible content."}]}]}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Common HTML Tags"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here are some essential HTML tags:"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"TagDescriptionExample"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<h1>"},{"type":"text","text":"–"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<h6>"},{"type":"text","text":"Headings (largest to smallest)"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<h1>Hello</h1><p>"},{"type":"text","text":"Paragraph"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<p>This is a paragraph.</p><strong>"},{"type":"text","text":"Bold text"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<strong>Important</strong><em>"},{"type":"text","text":"Italic text"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<em>Emphasized</em><br>"},{"type":"text","text":"Line break"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"First line<br>Second line<hr>"},{"type":"text","text":"Horizontal rule (line)"},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<hr>"}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Creating Links and Images"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":3},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Links"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To link to another page, use the "},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<a>"},{"type":"text","text":" tag:"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"typescript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"<a href="https://www.example.com">Visit Example.com</a>"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":3},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Images"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To display an image, use the "},{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"<img>"},{"type":"text","text":" tag:"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"typescript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"<img src="https://www.example.com/image.jpg" alt="Description">"}]},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"src"},{"type":"text","text":": Image URL or file path."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"alt"},{"type":"text","text":": Alternative text for screen readers."}]}]}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Lists in HTML"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":3},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Unordered List"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"typescript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"<ul> <li>Item One</li> <li>Item Two</li> </ul>"}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":3},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Ordered List"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"typescript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"<ol> <li>First</li> <li>Second</li> </ol>"}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Adding Comments"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Comments are not displayed in the browser. They are useful for notes in your code:"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"typescript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"<!-- This is a comment -->"}]},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Conclusion"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This covers the basics of HTML! To learn more, explore resources like:"}]},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow","class":"text-muted-foreground underline underline-offset-[3px] hover:text-primary transition-colors cursor-pointer"}},{"type":"underline"}],"text":"MDN Web Docs - HTML"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"link","attrs":{"href":"https://www.w3schools.com/html/","target":"_blank","rel":"nofollow","class":"text-muted-foreground underline underline-offset-[3px] hover:text-primary transition-colors cursor-pointer"}},{"type":"underline"}],"text":"W3Schools HTML Tutorial"}]}]}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Happy coding!"}]}]}

data.title: Heading Levels Test - H1 to H6
data.description: A comprehensive test of all six heading levels in HTML, demonstrating proper typography hierarchy, spacing, and design principles for accessible and readable content structure.
data.content: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This post demonstrates all six heading levels with proper typography and spacing."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":1},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heading Level 1 - Main Title"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is a paragraph following an H1 heading. It should have proper spacing and readability."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heading Level 2 - Section Title"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This paragraph follows an H2 heading. H2 headings are typically used for major sections."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":3},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heading Level 3 - Subsection Title"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H3 headings are used for subsections and should have distinct but harmonious styling."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":4},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heading Level 4 - Sub-subsection"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H4 headings provide further subdivision while maintaining readability hierarchy."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":5},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heading Level 5 - Minor Section"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H5 headings are useful for detailed breakdowns and minor sections within content."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":6},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Heading Level 6 - Smallest Heading"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H6 represents the smallest heading level, often used for fine-grained content organization."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Typography Hierarchy"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The heading hierarchy should provide clear visual distinction between different levels while maintaining consistency with the overall design system."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":3},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Design Principles"}]},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consistent font weights and spacing"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Clear size hierarchy from H1 to H6"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proper margins for visual breathing room"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Responsive typography that works on all devices"}]}]}]}]}

data.title: Modern JavaScript ES6+ Features
data.description: Explore the most important ES6+ features that every JavaScript developer should know, including arrow functions, destructuring, async/await, and more.

data.title: Understanding React Hooks
data.description: A comprehensive guide to React Hooks including useState, useEffect, useContext, and custom hooks. Learn how to manage state and side effects in functional components.

data.title: CSS Flexbox Complete Guide
data.description: Master CSS Flexbox with this comprehensive guide. Learn about flex containers, items, alignment, distribution, and practical examples for modern web layouts.

data.title: Building REST APIs with Node.js
data.description: Learn how to build robust REST APIs using Node.js and Express. Covers routing, middleware, error handling, authentication, and best practices for API development.

data.title: TypeScript for JavaScript Developers
data.description: Make the transition from JavaScript to TypeScript smoothly. Learn about type annotations, interfaces, generics, and how TypeScript can improve your code quality.

data.title: Git Workflow Best Practices
data.description: Learn essential Git workflows and best practices for team collaboration. Covers branching strategies, commit conventions, and effective version control techniques.
data.content:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":1},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Git Workflow Best Practices"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Effective Git workflows are crucial for team collaboration and project maintenance. Let's explore the best practices."}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Branching Strategy"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Use a consistent branching strategy like Git Flow:"}]},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"main"},{"type":"text","text":": Production-ready code"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"develop"},{"type":"text","text":": Integration branch for features"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"feature/*"},{"type":"text","text":": Individual feature branches"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"release/*"},{"type":"text","text":": Release preparation branches"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"code"}],"text":"hotfix/*"},{"type":"text","text":": Emergency fixes for production"}]}]}]},{"type":"heading","attrs":{"level":2},"content":[{"type":"text","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"text":"Commit Message Conventions"}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Follow conventional commit format:"}]},{"type":"codeBlock","attrs":{"language":"bash"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# Format: <type>(<scope>): <description>

feat(auth): add user login functionality
fix(api): resolve database connection issue
docs(readme): update installation instructions
style(css): improve button hover effects
refactor(utils): optimize helper functions"}]}]}

data.title: Responsive Web Design Principles
data.description: Master responsive web design with CSS Grid, Flexbox, and media queries. Learn how to create websites that work perfectly on all devices and screen sizes.

data.title: Web Performance Optimization Techniques
data.description: Boost your website's performance with proven optimization techniques. Learn about image optimization, code splitting, caching, and Core Web Vitals improvements.

data.title: Web Security Best Practices
data.description: Protect your web applications with essential security practices. Learn about HTTPS, authentication, authorization, XSS prevention, and secure coding principles.

data.title: JavaScript Testing with Jest
data.description: Learn how to write effective tests for your JavaScript applications using Jest. Covers unit testing, mocking, snapshot testing, and test-driven development.
